TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ScriptResourceDefinition extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IScriptResourceDefinition

Docs.summary: Defines the location of a script resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A ScriptResourceDefinition object represents a single logical script resource. This resource might have several different physical representations, such as a debug version, a release version, and a version on a content delivery network (CDN).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the debug mode path of the script resource on a content delivery network (CDN).
Docs.value: The path of a CDN that contains debug script resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you reference a CDN path, you can enable CDN support for the page by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.EnableCdn%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> to `true`.

Attribute.AttributeName: set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the release mode path of a script resource on a content delivery network (CDN).

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you reference a CDN path, you can enable CDN support for the page by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.EnableCdn%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> to `true`.

set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or set a value that indicates to the whether a script resource should be accessed using a secure connection to the content delivery network (CDN) path when the page is accessed using HTTPS.
Docs.value: if the CDN should be accessed using HTTPS; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the CdnSupportsSecureConnection property to check whether the associated script resource should be accessed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> using a secure connection (SSL) to a CDN. By using the CdnSupportsSecureConnection property, you can avoid a warning message from the browser when your Web application attempts to request secure content from a CDN that supports SSL.

Attribute.AttributeName: set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the debug mode path of the script resource that is used when debug mode is enabled.
Docs.value: The path of a script resource that is used when debug mode is enabled.

Docs.value: The path of a script resource.

Docs.value: An assembly object that contains a script resource.
